messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

I reused the letter 't', which is what ls -l shows when the sticky bit
is set. 't' is also used by ModeTemporary, which is only on Plan 9.
Plan 9 has no sticky bit as far as I can tell, so strings shouldn't be
ambiguous, but I'm pointing it out since someone might disagree.

- Evan

LGTM

Let's change the plan 9 bit to T.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=b9233f330895 ***

os: add ModeSticky

R=golang-dev, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5539063

Committer: Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Not sure what sends these emails, but it apparently did it three times.
 It's REALLY SUBMITTED now.

On Thu, Jan 19, 2012 at 11:29 AM, <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:

> *** Submitted as
> http://code.google.com/p/go/**source/detail?r=b9233f330895<http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=b9233f330895>***
